title: Waimakariri, river from the snows
creator_contributor_role: New Zealand National Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Rivers - Regulation
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural resources - Environmental aspects
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Soil erosion
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Water resources development
description: An account of the history of the Waimakariri River in Canterbury Province, New Zealand. Shows attempts at solving such problems as flooding, and soil erosion in the catchment areas. The Waimakariri River Trust is attempting to restore land laid bare by soil erosion. Methods used include the planting of grass and trees on sandy hillslopes and the building of artificial river banks.
